xierpa3.components.featured package¶

Submodules¶

xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbase module¶

class xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbase.FeaturedBase(components=None, style=None, id=None, parent=None, name=None, css=None, fonts=None, prefix=None, class_=None, type=None, contentID=None, repeat=1, title=None, url=None, template=None, editable=False, adapter=None, selector=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: xierpa3.components.column.Column

Abstract class that combines functionality for inheriting Featured classes.

C¶

alias of Constants

CLASS_FEATURED_ITEM = 'featuredItem'¶
CLASS_FEATURED_ITEM_IMG = 'featuredItemImg'¶
buildColumn(b)¶

Get the featured article and build the feature, depending on the type of inheriting class. The selectors @start@ and @count@ define which and how many articles are selected.

xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbyimage module¶

class xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbyimage.FeaturedByImage(components=None, style=None, id=None, parent=None, name=None, css=None, fonts=None, prefix=None, class_=None, type=None, contentID=None, repeat=1, title=None, url=None, template=None, editable=False, adapter=None, selector=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbase.FeaturedBase

The @FeaturedByImage@ feature component, shows a featured article by its poster image on full width of the component. If there is no poster image defined in the article meta data, then the first image in the article is used here. The image is a link to the article page. Respectively the binary flags @BluePrint@ showLevel, showTitle and showTopic will enable the level of the article (as defined in the article source @$level@), the article title (@$title@) and topic (@$topic), of set to @True@.

AUTHORCOLOR = #828386¶
AUTHORSIZE = 1.20em¶
BLUEPRINT = <BluePrint: <BluePrint: Untitled>>¶

xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbyimagelist module¶

class xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbyimagelist.FeaturedByImageList(components=None, style=None, id=None, parent=None, name=None, css=None, fonts=None, prefix=None, class_=None, type=None, contentID=None, repeat=1, title=None, url=None, template=None, editable=False, adapter=None, selector=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbase.FeaturedBase

The FeaturedByImageList feature component builds a vertical list if thumbnails, level and optional names of the selected article chapters.

xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbytext module¶

class xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbytext.FeaturedByText(components=None, style=None, id=None, parent=None, name=None, css=None, fonts=None, prefix=None, class_=None, type=None, contentID=None, repeat=1, title=None, url=None, template=None, editable=False, adapter=None, selector=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: xierpa3.components.featured.featuredbase.FeaturedBase

The @FeaturedByText@ feature component, shows a featured article by summary. Respectively the binary flags @BluePrint@ showPoster, showLevel, showTitle and showTopic will enable the level of the article (as defined in the article source @$level@), the article title (@$title@) and topic (@$topic), of set to @True@.

xierpa3.components.featured.posterhead module¶

class xierpa3.components.featured.posterhead.PosterHead(components=None, style=None, id=None, parent=None, name=None, css=None, fonts=None, prefix=None, class_=None, type=None, contentID=None, repeat=1, title=None, url=None, template=None, editable=False, adapter=None, selector=None, **kwargs)¶

Bases: xierpa3.components.column.Column

The @PosterHead@ component, shows a featured article by its poster image on full width of the component, and adding the title and the text a overlay with shadow. If there is no poster image defined in the article meta data, then the first image in the article is used here. The poster image is a link to the article page. Respectively the binary flags @BluePrint@ showLevel, showTitle and showTopic will enable the level of the article (as defined in the article source @$level@), the article title (@$title@) and topic (@$topic), of set to @True@.

BLUEPRINT = <BluePrint: <BluePrint: Untitled>>¶
